data.title: First Generation
data.text:
1.Edgar Witcher15 was born on May 5, 1824 in Indiana, United States.

He appeared in the census in 1850 in Perry Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (26), Mary (22) and Rufus (2). He appeared in the census in 1860 in Perry Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (35) in the Aaron Houghton household. He appeared in the census in 1870 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (46), Jane (35), Phebe (8) and Arthur (1).

He served in the military in the American Civil War. He enlisted as a private in Company K, 143rd Indiana Infantry on February 4, 1865. His residence was listed as Loogootee, IN. He mustered out on October 17, 1865 in Nashville, TN. Eliza Jane Perry Witcher filed for his pension in October 1881.

He died on January 10, 1878 at the age of 53 in Martin, Indiana, United States. He was buried at Reilly-Houghton Cemetery in Martin, Indiana, United States.

Edgar Witcher and Mary Smith were married on June 15, 1847. They were divorced between 1854 and 1860. This is based on Fariba's birth date and the fact that Mary had remarried before the 1860 census. Mary Smith1,5 was born about 1828 in Indiana, United States. Wendy Henry reported her birth place as North Carolina. She appeared in the census in 1850 in Perry Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1860 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She died Unknown.

Edgar Witcher and Mary Smith had the following children:

2 i. Rufus Witcher, born about 1848.

3 ii. Sarah Ann "Sallie" Witcher, born July 3, 1849.

4 iii. Isabelle Witcher, born January 10, 1851.

5 iv. Fariba Witcher, born March 2, 1854.

Edgar Witcher and Eliza Jane Perry were married on February 28, 1861 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 2, page 78). Eliza Jane Perry13 was born in September, 1837 in Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1870 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Jane (42), Phoebe (17), Arthur (11), Josephine (8) and Edgar (6). She appeared in the census in 1900 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Jane (62) and Edgar (26). She appeared in the census in 1910 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Jane (72) and Edgar (36). She died in 1919 at the age of 82. She was buried at Reilly-Houghton Cemetery in Martin, Indiana, United States.

Edgar Witcher and Eliza Jane Perry had the following children:

6 i. Phoebe Witcher, born about 1862.

7 ii. Arthur Witcher, born July 23, 1868.

8 iii. Josephine "Josie" Witcher, born March 2, 1872.

9 iv. Edgar Witcher, born March 2, 1874.

Second Generation

2. Rufus Witcher1 was born about 1848 in Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1850 in Perry Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1860 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He died Unknown.

3. Sarah Ann "Sallie" Witcher1,3,6 was born on July 3, 1849 in Martin, Indiana, United States.

She appeared in the census in 1850 in Perry Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1870 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Huron, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. It lists Sarah (60), married, living with son Thomas. Robert is living in a different county, also listed as married, so they must have separated between 1900 and 1910. She appeared in the census in 1920 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. It lists Sarah (70), widow, living with son Thomas.

She died in 1925 at the age of 76. She was buried at Orleans IOOF Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

Sarah Ann "Sallie" Witcher and Robert F. Peek were married on August 2, 1868 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 2, page 491). Robert F. Peek1,3 was born on December 24, 1843 in South Carolina, United States. His Find-A-Grave memorial and most postings on Ancestry.com report the year as 1843. He reported 1841 in the 1900 census. He was a blacksmith. He appeared in the census in 1870 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Robert (26), Sarah (21) and Lorena (1). His occupation was wagon maker. He appeared in the census in 1880 in Huron, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. It lists Robert (36), Sarah (30), Lorena (10), Lewis (9), Oscar (7), Mary (4) and Juliet (1). He appeared in the census in 1900 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Robert (58), Sarah (50), Lewis (29), Oscar (26), and Thomas (19). He appeared in the census in 1910 in District 3, Meade, Kentucky, United States. It lists Robert (66), married, boarding with William Griffith. His occupation was blacksmith at a rented shop. Sarah was living with son Thomas in a different county, so they must have separated. Robert died on January 27, 1912 at the age of 68 in Oldham, Kentucky, United States. He was buried at Peewee Valley Cemetery in Oldham, Kentucky, United States.

Robert F. Peek and Sarah Ann Witcher had the following children:

10 i. Lorena Abigale Peek, born June 18, 1869.

11 ii. Lewis Edgar Peek, born January 22, 1871.

12 iii. Oscar E. Peek, born September 22, 1873.

13 iv. Mary Frances Peek, born May 14, 1876.

14 v. Etta B. "Juliet" Peek, born about 1879.

15 vi. Thomas Peek, born January 3, 1881.

4. Isabelle Witcher1,3,7 was born on January 10, 1851 in Loogootee, Martin, Indiana, United States.

She appeared in the census in 1860 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1870 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States.

She died on September 23, 1888 at the age of 37 in Covina, Los Angeles, California, United States. She was buried at Oakdale Memorial Park in Los Angeles, California, United States.

Isabelle Witcher and David A. Norcross were married on October 10, 1867 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 2, page 434). David A. Norcross1,34,7, son of Elijah Norcross and Eleanor Drake, was born on December 9, 1842 in White, Illinois, United States. He appeared in the census in 1850 in Perry Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1860 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He served in the military in the American Civil War. He enlisted as a private in Company E, Indiana 18th Infantry Regiment on August 16, 1861. He mustered out on August 1, 1865. His record indicates that he was wounded during his service and applied as an invalid on August 10, 1865. His widow Melissa applied for benefits on May 20, 1924. He appeared in the census in 1870 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists David (26), Isabell (19), Laura (2) and Leona (6/12). He appeared in the census in 1880 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists David (37), Isabel (29), Leona (10), Charles (8), Ishmael (6), Justin (4) and Edgar (2). He appeared in the census in 1900 in Wayne Township, Wayne County, OH. It lists David (57) and Cevilla (42) living with her mother. His occupation was farmer. He appeared in the census in 1910 in San Jose Township, Los Angeles, California, United States. It lists David (67), Melissa (55) and Homer (17). He had no occupation. He appeared in the census in 1920 in La Verne, Los Angeles, California, United States. I t lists David (77) and Melissa (65). He died on April 28, 1924 at the age of 81 in La Verne, Los Angeles, California, United States. He was buried at Oakdale Memorial Park in Los Angeles, California, United States. David and both wives are buried together.

David A. Norcross and Isabelle Witcher had the following children:

16 i. Laura B. Norcross, born August 2, 1868.

17 ii. Leona E. Norcross, born January 22, 1870.

18 iii. Charles D. Norcross, born January 27, 1872.

19 iv. Ishmael Worth Norcross, born May 17, 1874.

20 v. Justin C. Norcross, born February 15, 1876.

21 vi. Edgar D. Norcross, born April 3, 1878.

22 vii. Stella Norcross, born May 11, 1883.

23 viii. Arthur Norcross, born September 8, 1888.

5. Fariba Witcher3,811 was born on March 2, 1854 in Martin, Indiana, United States. Her death certificate listed the year as 1844, which is clearly incorrect. Her grave stone lists the year as 1853. Her last name is listed as Mitchell in daughter Emma Dot's birth record.

She appeared in the census in 1860 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1870 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Northwest Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Northwest Township, Orange, Indiana, United States.

Fariba died on December 9, 1910 at the age of 56 in West Baden, Orange, Indiana, United States (book H-11, page 80). Her death certificate reported the following: cause of death was liver cancer, occupation was housewife, marital status was married to George Connell. She was buried at Ames Chapel Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

Fariba Witcher and George Tindall were married on July 4, 1869 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 2, page 545). George Tindall3 was born about 1848 in Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1870 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists George (22) and Fariba (17). His occupation was worker in a shoe shop. He died Unknown. It was probably before 1878, when Fariba remarried.

Fariba Witcher and George Washington Connell were married on September 8, 1878 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 4, page 84). George Washington Connell1,3,810, son of Harrison Connell and Elizabeth D. Jones, was born in January, 1856 in Martin, Indiana, United States. He was a farmer. He appeared in the census in 1860 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1870 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1880 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists George (25), Fariba (27) and Frederick (1). He appeared in the census in 1900 in Northwest Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists George (44), Fariba (46), Fred (21), Samuel (19), Jean (17), Floren (15), Emma (14), Orville (11), Clyde (8) and Dessie (6). He appeared in the census in 1910 in Northwest Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists George (54), Fariba (56), Florin (27), Orville (21), Clyde (18) and Dessie (18). He died in 1926 at the age of 70 in Orange, Indiana, United States. He was buried at Ames Chapel Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

George Washington Connell and Fariba Witcher had the following children:

24 i. Frederick "Fred" Connell, born May 17, 1879.

25 ii. Samuel Lewis Connell, born September 25, 1880.

26 iii. Jeanette Olive "Jennie" Connell, born July 18, 1882.

27 iv. Floren Connell, born July 30, 1884.

28 v. Emma Dot Connell, born April 17, 1886.

29 vi. Orville Buck Connell, born March 11, 1889.

30 vii. Clyde Harry Connell, born August 2, 1891.

31 viii. Dessie Pearl Connell, born March 14, 1894.

32 ix. Mitchell Connell, born Unknown.

33 x. Nellie Connell, born Unknown.

6. Phoebe Witcher1,3 was born about 1862 in Martin, Indiana, United States.

She appeared in the census in 1870 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States.

She died before 1888. This is based on the fact that Robert remarried that year. She may have died in Illinois.

Phoebe Witcher and Robert Andrew Harshaw were married on October 4, 1881 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 4, page 302). Robert Andrew Harshaw1,3, son of Robert Harshaw and Elizabeth Emrick, was born on July 14, 1853 in Butler, Butler, Pennsylvania, United States. He appeared in the census in 1860 in Parker Township, Butler, Pennsylvania, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Jacksonville, Morgan, Illinois, United States. It lists Robert (46), Rebecca (37), Murley (17), Ila (7) and Eula (3). His occupation was ice wagon laborer. He died Unknown.

Robert Andrew Harshaw and Phoebe Witcher had the following child:

34 i. Merley Clay Harshaw, born August 9, 1882.

7. Arthur Witcher13,11 was born on July 23, 1868 in Martin, Indiana, United States.

He appeared in the census in 1870 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1880 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Arthur (29), Ella (26) and Elmo (6). He appeared in the census in 1910 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Arthur (41), Ella (35), Elmo (16) and Horace (8). His occupation was farmer. He appeared in the census in 1920 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Arthur (51), Ella (45) and Horace (18) in the household of his brother Edgar. His occupation was tire man at a garage. Arthur appeared in the census in 1930 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Arthur (61), Ella (56) and brother Edgar (56) living on Main Street. His occupation was garage manager.

He died in 1940 at the age of 72 at Madison State Hospital in Madison, Jefferson, Indiana, United States. His death certificate reported the following: cause of death was arteriosclerosis, residence was Shoals, Indiana, occupation was farmer, marital status was married to Ella Witcher. He was buried at Springhill Cemetery in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States.

Arthur Witcher and Ella Jane Williams were married on October 18, 1893 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 5, page 517). Siblings Arthur and Josephine Witcher married siblings Ella and George Williams. Ella Jane Williams13,1113, daughter of James Albert Williams and Mary Catherine Yenne, was born on February 1, 1874 in Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1920 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1930 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1940 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Ella (66), widow, living alone at 112 Main Street. Her highest level of education was 8th grade. She died on February 28, 1969 at the age of 95 at Prairie Village Nursing Home in Washington, Daviess, Indiana, United States. Her death certificate reported the following: cause of death was cerebral thrombosis, occupation was housewife, marital status was widow. She was buried on December 31, 1969 at Springhill Cemetery in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States.

Arthur Witcher and Ella Jane Williams had the following children:

35 i. Elmo Witcher, born April 15, 1894.

36 ii. Horace A. Witcher, born September 29, 1901.

8. Josephine "Josie" Witcher13,11 was born on March 2, 1872 in Martin, Indiana, United States. This date is from her grave stone. Her death certificate reported the year as 1873.

She appeared in the census in 1880 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States.

She died on September 8, 1911 at the age of 39 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States (book COH-12, page 66). Her death certificate reported the following: cause of death was dysentery [illegible] due to premature labor, occupation was house work, marital status was married to George Williams. She died just 3 days after daughter Minnie was born. She was buried at Springhill Cemetery in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States.

Josephine "Josie" Witcher and George Arthur Williams were married on October 27, 1896 in Martin, Indiana, United States (book 6, page 119). Siblings Josephine and Arthur Witcher married siblings George and Ella Williams. George Arthur Williams13, son of James Albert Williams and Mary Catherine Yenne, was born on May 10, 1869 in Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1880 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists George (31), Josephine (28), Jennie (2), Herbert (4/12) and Herschel (4/12). He appeared in the census in 1910 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists George (40), Josephine (38), Jennie (12), Herbert (10), Herschel (10), Leona (7) and Everett (2/12). He died on November 12, 1933 at the age of 64 in Bedford, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. He was buried at Springhill Cemetery in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States.

George Arthur Williams and Josephine Witcher had the following children:

37 i. Jennie M. Williams, born February, 1898.

38 ii. Herschel James Williams, born January 15, 1900.

39 iii. Herbert Edgar Williams, born January 15, 1900.

40 iv. Leona May Williams, born December 4, 1902.

41 v. Lelia Williams, born August 7, 1907.

42 vi. Everett Arthur Williams, born July 2, 1909.

43 vii. Minnie Druezelia Williams, born September 5, 1911.

9 Edgar Witcher12,4,11,13 was born on March 2, 1874 in Martin, Indiana, United States. He was a bank cashier. The 1900 census reported that he worked for the Martin County Bank.

His World War I draft registration card described him as medium height, medium build, brown eyes and black hair, residence was Shoals, Indiana, occupation was bank cashier for the Martin County Bank, nearest relative was his mother.

He appeared in the census in 1880 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (28) living with his mother. He appeared in the census in 1910 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (36) living with his mother. He appeared in the census in 1920 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (45) and brother Arthur and his family. He appeared in the census in 1930 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (56) living with brother Arthur. He appeared in the census in 1940 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Edgar (66), Grace (47) and John (1). His occupation was bank cashier. His highest level of education was 8th grade, Grace's was 12th grade.

He died on October 6, 1967 at the age of 93 at Memorial Hospital in Jasper, Dubois, Indiana, United States. His death certificate reported the following: cause of death was acute pulmonary edema, residence was Shoals, Indiana, occupation was retired banker, marital status was married to Grace Witcher. He was buried at Springhill Cemetery in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States.

Edgar Witcher and Grace Louisa Shrum were married about 1938. This date is based on the age of their son. Grace Louisa Shrum12,11,13, daughter of Caleb Shrum and Ingabie Smith, was born on August 22, 1892 in Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1920 in Center Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Grace (27) boarding in the A.J. Grafton household. Her occupation was bank bookkeeper. She appeared in the census in 1930 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists Grace (36), single. Her occupation was bank clerk. She appeared in the census in 1940 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. She died on April 24, 1974 at the age of 81 in Tucson, Pima, Arizona, United States. The Tucson Daily Citizen (April 25, 1974) reported "Witcher, Grace L., 81, of Tucson, passed away April 24th. A retired teacher. Widow of Edgar Witcher a retired banker. Survived by son John and two grandsons. Funeral services will be Saturday, April 27th, at the Queen's Funeral Home, Shoals, Indiana. In lieu of flowers family request donations to the American Heart Association. Local arrangements by Hudgel's Swan Funeral Home, 22nd and Swan." She was buried at Springhill Cemetery in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States.

Edgar Witcher and Grace Louisa Shrum had the following child:

44 i. Living Witcher.

Third Generation

10. Lorena Abigale Peek1,11 was born on June 18, 1869 in Martin, Indiana, United States. The year is from her grave stone. Her death certificate reported 1868, but this would place her birth before her parents were married.

She appeared in the census in 1870 in Shoals, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Huron, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States.

She died on December 17, 1947 at the age of 78 in Odon, Daviess, Indiana, United States. Her death certificate reported the following: cause of death was coronary occlusion, occupation was housewife, marital status was widow of George Hawkins. She was buried at Springhill Cemetery in Martin, Indiana, United States.

Lorena Abigale Peek and George M. Hawkins were married in 1897 in Martin, Indiana, United States. The license was issued on January 30, but the date the ceremony was performed is unknown. George M. Hawkins1,3,11 was born on June 19, 1864 in Martin, Indiana, United States. He was a farmer. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Columbia Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists George (35), Lorena (31) and Adrian (1). He appeared in the census in 1910 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. It lists George (45), Lorena (40), Adrian (11), Robert (9), Harry (7), Fay (4) and Myrtle (2). He died on December 15, 1947 at the age of 83 in Odon, Daviess, Indiana, United States. His death certificate reported the following: cause of death was cerebral hemorrhage, occupation was retired farmer, marital status was married to Lorena Peek Hawkins. He was buried at Springhill Cemetery in Martin, Indiana, United States.

11. Lewis Edgar Peek1,3,6 was born on January 22, 1871 in Indiana, United States. His death certificate reported the year as 1865, but this was before his parents were married.

He appeared in the census in 1880 in Huron, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Lewis (29) living with his parents. His occupation was day laborer. He appeared in the census in 1910 in Nappanee, Elkhart, Indiana, United States. It lists Lewis (38) and Grace (38). It states that they did not have any children. His occupation was physician. He appeared in the census in 1920 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Louis (49) and Grace (48). His occupation was masseur. He appeared in the census in 1930 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Lewis (60), Grace (60), mother-in-law Josephine Jones (83) and sister-in-law Ethel Sallmon (54). His occupation was masseur.

He died on November 27, 1934 at the age of 63 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. His death certificate reported the following: cause of death was cerebral apoplexy, occupation was masseur, marital status was married to Grace Peek. He was buried at Orleans IOOF Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

Lewis Edgar Peek and Grace L. Jones were married on January 1, 1901 in Miami, Indiana, United States (book C-10, page 552). Grace L. Jones1,3,6 was born about 1872 in Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Nappanee, Elkhart, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1920 in French Lick Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1930 in French Lick Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. She died in 1939 at the age of 67 in Orange, Indiana, United States. She was buried at Orleans IOOF Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

12. Oscar E. Peek1,11 was born on September 22, 1873 in Indiana, United States.

He appeared in the census in 1880 in Huron, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Oscar (26) living with his parents. His occupation was soldier. Oscar appeared in the census in 1910 in Fort Thomas, Campbell, Kentucky, United States. It lists Oscar (37), single. He appeared in the census in 1920 at Camp Meade in Ann Arundel, Maryland, United States. It lists Oscar (46), married. No family is listed. He appeared in the census in 1930 in Long Beach, Los Angeles, California, United States. It lists Oscar (57), Grace (46) and Ethel (8). He had no occupation.

He died on October 9, 1961 at the age of 88 in Long Beach, Los Angeles, California, United States. The California Death Index reports his place of death as Los Angeles.

Oscar E. Peek and Grace T. [Unknown] were married about 1920. This date is based on the 1930 census. Grace T. [Unknown] was born about 1884 in West Virginia, United States. She appeared in the census in 1930 in Long Beach, Los Angeles, California, United States. She died Unknown.

13. Mary Frances Peek1,3,11 was born on May 14, 1876 in Indiana, United States.

She appeared in the census in 1880 in Huron, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. Mary appeared in the census in 1910 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1920 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1930 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. Mary appeared in the census in 1940 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Mary (63), widow, and brother-in-law Hoover Kearby (81). Her highest level of education was 5th grade.

She died on January 27, 1944 at the age of 67 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. Her death certificate reported the following: cause of death was leakage of heart, occupation was housework, marital status was widow of Harry Kearby. She was buried at Orleans IOOF Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

Mary Frances Peek and Harry G. Kearby were married on December 15, 1897 in Orange, Indiana, United States (book C-9, page 149). Harry G. Kearby1,3,6 was born on March 15, 1867 in Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Harry (33) and Frances (24). His occupation was railroad fireman. He appeared in the census in 1910 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Harry (43), Mary (33), Gertrude (9) and Waver (6). His occupation was railroad fireman. Harry appeared in the census in 1920 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Harry (52), Mary (43), Gertrude (19) and Waver (15). His occupation was railroad depot foreman. He appeared in the census in 1930 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Harry (63), Mary (53) and Waver (25). His occupation was railroad watchman. He died on February 13, 1939 at the age of 71 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. His death certificate reported the following: cause of death was angina pectoris, residence was Orleans, Orange, Indiana, occupation was railroader, marital status was married to Mary Frances Kearby. He was buried at Orleans IOOF Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

14. Etta B. "Juliet" Peek1,3 was born about 1879 in Indiana, United States. The marriage index lists her as Etta B., but she is listed as Juliet in the 1880 census.

She appeared in the census in 1880 in Huron, Lawrence, Indiana, United States.

She died Unknown. It was likely before 1909, when Oscar remarried.

Etta B. "Juliet" Peek and Oscar Curtis Peters were married on May 1, 1898 in Orange, Indiana, United States (book C-9, page 264). Oscar Curtis Peters3 was born on January 31, 1878 in Salem, Washington, Indiana. He died on August 13, 1957 at the age of 79 at Dunn Memorial Hospital in Bedford, Lawrence, Indiana, United States. He was buried at Green Hill Cemetery in Lawrence, Indiana, United States.

15. Thomas Peek1,4,11 was born on January 3, 1881 in Indiana, United States.

His World War I draft registration card described him as tall, stout build, blue eyes and gray hair, residence was 113 Center St. in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, occupation was telegraph operator for the Southern Railroad.

He appeared in the census in 1900 in Orleans, Orange, Indiana, United States. His occupation was day laborer. He appeared in the census in 1910 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. It lists Thomas (28), Nellie (24), Louise (2) and his mother Sarah (60). His occupation was telegraph operator. He appeared in the census in 1920 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. It lists Thomas (38), Nellie (35), Louise (12) and his mother Sarah (70). He appeared in the census in 1930 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. It lists Thomas (49) and Nellie (43). His occupation was telegraph operator. He appeared in the census in 1940 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. It lists Thomas (59), Nellie (54) and Louise (32). His occupation was railroad agent. His highest level of education was 4th grade, Nellie's was 8th grade.

He died on December 2, 1943 at the age of 62 at Good Samaritan Hospital in Lexington, Fayette, Kentucky, United States (vol. 3, certificate 26391). His death certificate reported the following: cause of death was coronary occlusion, residence was Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, occupation was agent for the Southern Railroad, marital status was married. He was buried at Lawrenceburg Cemetery in Anderson, Kentucky, United States.

Thomas Peek and Nellie Garrison were married on December 28, 1906 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. Nellie Garrison1,11 was born on May 8, 1886 in Kentucky, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. She appeared in the census in 1920 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. Nellie appeared in the census in 1930 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. She appeared in the census in 1940 in Lawrenceburg, Anderson, Kentucky, United States. She died on March 2, 1964 at the age of 79 in Anderson, Kentucky, United States (vol. 11, certificate 05178). She was buried at Lawrenceburg Cemetery in Anderson, Kentucky, United States.

16. Laura B. Norcross1 was born on August 2, 1868 in Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1870 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She died on October 31, 1870 at the age of 2.

17. Leona E. Norcross1 was born on January 22, 1870 in Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1870 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1880 in Halbert Township, Martin, Indiana, United States. Leona died Unknown.

His death certificate reported the following: cause of death was influenza, residence was 725 Rochester in Indianapolis, Indiana, occupation was not listed, marital status was married to Grace Connell. The Springs Valley Herald (February 18, 1937) reported "Samuel L. Connell, 56, died Sunday at his home in Indianapolis after a two year illness. Mr. Connell was born in Orange County, but had been a resident of Indianapolis for several years where he had employment at the Prest-O-Lite company for eight years. He is survived by the wife and one daughter. He is also a brother to Mrs. Charles Lane of French Lick and Orville Connell of West Baden. Funeral services and burial were held at Indianapolis Wednesday morning." He was buried at Bethel Cemetery in Marion, Indiana, United States.

26. Jeanette Olive "Jennie" Connell1,3,10 was born on July 18, 1882 in Martin, Indiana, United States. The Ames Chapel Cemetery transcriptions list her birth as 1892, but this must be an error (see her obituary).

She appeared in the census in 1900 in Northwest Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in French Lick Township, Orange, Indiana, United States.

She died on July 30, 1919 at the age of 37 in West Baden, Orange, Indiana, United States. Her death certificate reported the following: cause of death was pulmonary carcinoma, occupation was housewife, marital status was married to Elmer Scarlett. The Springs Valley Herald (August 21, 1919) reported "Jeanette Olive (Connell) Scarlett, daughter of George and Farrabee Witcher Connell was born near Shoals, Ind., July 18, 1882, and died at her home in West Baden, Ind., July 30, 1919, age 37 years, 12 days. She was married to Elmer Scarlett Dec. 2, 1901, to which union were born three children; Eva, 14 years, Baby Marie, 16 months, who together with the husband survive her, and an infant who died at birth. Her father and brothers, Fred, Sam, Floren, Orville and Clyde, and sisters, Emma Lane and Dessa Marshall survive her. During the summer of 1909 Mrs. Scarlett united with the First Baptist Church of West Baden, under the pastorate of Rev. C. A. Wade, later transferring her membership to Paoli Baptist Church, upon removing her home to Paoli, and the light of her faith never dimmed, she had long weeks of suffering (14 weeks in bed) and the knowledge that she was not to recover, came to her own mind. She called to her bedside her friend, Mrs. Ed. Nuss (who had long been like a sister to her) and explained in detail the plans she wished carried out in the funeral. She wanted to live, particularly for her family - they needed her so - but expressed continually her readiness to die, if it be the Lord's Will. Her last audible words were: 'Dear Precious Lord.' Jeannie was rather a self-conscious woman, not showy in her life, but quick in sympathy, loyal and earnest, full of live for the beautiful, beautiful herself, she loved the best, in material and spiritual things. Only a girl, in years, but who shall estimate or measure the scope of her life in influence upon the stricken home from which she has flown like the eagle, mounting higher and higher until, all at once we realized she is not with us, she has gone to be with God. To realize the fullness of his promises, leaving behind her the wonderful legacies of wifehood and motherhood, beautifully lived - her own life made beautiful by suffering, until the perfume therefrom pervades the atmosphere wherein her life was lived, and she has but gone on, out of sight, for a time, as if into another room, with Him face to face." She was buried at Ames Chapel Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

Emma Dot Connell and Charles Edward "Charley" Lane were married on September 14, 1904 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. (book H-3, page 13). Charles Edward "Charley" Lane1,34,1011,1719, son of Martin Van Buren Lane and Martha Shively, was born on September 16, 1878 in Orange, Indiana, United States. James Edward Lane reported that Charles was a barber during the early years of his life. Later, he operated a small grocery store across from the post office in French Lick, IN, until shortly after World War II. The 1929 telephone directory lists his store at 205 College Street. When coffee was a nickel a cup, with no free refills, Charley had the reputation of drinking his cup two-thirds to three-quarters of the way down, then asking for his coffee to be "warmed up". Long after his death, there were people in southern Indiana, when they wanted their coffee warmed, would say "Charley Lane my coffee". His World War I draft registration card described him as medium height, medium build, blue eyes and light hair, residence was 210 Maple in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, occupation was night watchman for Mr. Taggart and the railroad, contact was Emma Lane. Registrar's Report said "ankles imperfect due to accident." His World War II draft registration card described him as 5' 9", 185 lbs., residence was 210 Maple, French Lick, Orange, Indiana, occupation was self-employed. He appeared in the census in 1880 in Jackson Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. He appeared in the census in 1900 in French Lick Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Charley (21) living with his mother. His occupation was barber. He appeared in the census in 1910 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Charles (31), Emma (24), Chester (3) and Clarence (1). His occupation was barber shop proprietor, the same as his brother Perry. Did they work together? He appeared in the census in 1920 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Charles (40), Emma (33), Chester (13), Clarence (11) and Edyth (5). His occupation was barber at Hotel. He appeared in the census in 1930 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Charles (49), Emma (44) and Edith (16) at 210 Maple Street in French Lick. His occupation was grocery merchant. He appeared in the census in 1940 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. It lists Charles (60) and Emma (54) living on Maple Street. His occupation was grocery store manager. His highest level of education was 8th grade, hers was the same. He died on August 22, 1957 at the age of 78 in French Lick, Orange, Indiana, United States. His death certificate reported the following: place of death was at home, cause of death was coronary occlusion, residence was 210 Maple St. in French Lick, Indiana, occupation was Barber and merchant, marital status was widower. He was buried at Ames Chapel Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

Lowell Martha Knight1,3,10, daughter of Hardin Thomas Knight and Olive Belle Abel, was born on May 15, 1894 in Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1900 in Orangeville Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Northwest Township, Orange, Indiana, United States. Her death certificate reported the following: cause of death was cerebro vascular accident (stroke), marital status was widow. Her obituary reported "Lowell M. Connell, age 87, died at 4:10 a.m. Monday, March 22 at Medco Center in French Lick. She was born May 15, 1894, the second child of the late Hardin T. and Olive Belle Abel Knight. She was united in marriage August 12, 1911 to Orville Connell, who preceded her in death in 1958. Two sons, Dennis and Garrett preceded her in death. She is survived by two sons, Clarence of Indianapolis and Clifford of Phoenix, Ariz.; four daughters-in-law, Mrs. Alma Connell, Manhatten Beach, Calif., Mrs. Ingrid Connell, Phoenix, Ariz., Mrs. Margaret Connell and Mrs. Margie Connell Cox, both of Indianapolis; two sisters, Mrs. Ora Underwood, West Baden, Mrs. Bertha McDonald, Marysville, Calif.; three sisters-in-law, Mrs. Della Knight, West Baden, Mrs. Julia Knight, Orleans, and Mrs. Debby Knight, Phoenix, Ariz.; seven grandchildren and six great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews. She had been a resident of Orleans the past nine years before becoming a resident of Medco Center May 1, 1981. She was a member of the First Christian Church of Orleans. Funeral services will be conducted Saturday, March 27, 2:00 p.m. from Brosmer-Drabing Funeral Home with Rev. Dennis E. Lee officiating. Burial will be in Ames Chapel Cemetery. Friends may call at the funeral home from 5:00 to 9:00 p.m. Friday." She was buried on March 27, 1982 at Ames Chapel Cemetery in Orange, Indiana, United States.

Notes

1.Census Data: Rather than repeat the detail from a family census entry in each persons record, it has been recorded only in the Head of Household record, and only the census year and location are recorded in the family member records (with a few exceptions, like adult children living with their parents). If you are reviewing a person who is not the Head of Household, be sure to look at the Head of Household entry to see if there is additional information.

2.Name Spelling: The spelling of names in source documents is often incorrect, with the name being spelled the way the writer thought it sounded. The spelling could be different in every document. In most cases the name is reported in this document as it was written, but some gross misspellings have been corrected.

3.Direct Ancestral Line: The direct ancestors of Robert Edward Lane are highlighted in blue.
